title: RIP Top Lane 2010 - 2015
body:
Who else can't wait to get poked out of lane and kited to death by champions who are not only ranged and do tons of damage, but also as tanky as you? 

{{champion:104}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:133}} 

I wouldn't be surprised if this was the last season for League of Legends. I think they're taking it too far this time.

Also, as much as tanks got shafted in the last several patches of this season and will be next season, HOLY FUCK what did Rito do to those poor mages??? RIP mid lane. Incoming AD meta with Assassin/Bruiser/ADC circlejerk slaughterfest where everyone dies in two hits and will make Season  3 League of Black Cleaver look tame by comparison. 

What a fucking disaster.

This is actually only half true.

LW got better in the sense that you can counter armor stacking earlier (1300 gold).

However, due to the way base Armor works, LW is now strictly inferior against reasonable tanks than the previous version.

Most tanky champions have around 30 armor somewhere at level 1-3. For the new LW upgrades to be as efficient as before, you'd need about 200 bonus Armor - at levels 1-3.

On level 18, most tankies have around 90 base armor. For new LW to be better, you'd need 600 bonus armor. And that's a stretch even for malphite.

The only reason I could see this being a problem is if LW is being rushed to counter a tanky laner. (whether it was a top lane ADC or a lane swap.) But even that would be risky.

The whole reason why Quinn is the most annoying thing to lane against for the majority of top laners is because of her blind. I think I saw that they're removing that. Only Teemo will have it. Blind keeps both of them safe from gap closers and the all-in nature of top lane. That is the only way for melee champions to battle ranged ones.

Most marksmen can't make it work in top lane because top laners tend to have strong early games and usually the victor is decided before any other lane. This is in contrast to the weaker early games marksmen tend to have, which is why we rarely see them out of bot lane where it's marksman vs marksman each with a support.

Marksmen did need a change, but I'm sort of bummed that the AD items focus on just them. It seems a little unfair, but I don't think we'll be seeing marksmen head top all that much.

More knee-jerk reactions from balance "masters."

Or you know.... the current meta could change and our tunnel visioned idea of "top tank/fighter, mid mage/assassin, jungle tank/assassin, duo bot with a marksman and a support" might change into something different. 

Honestly I can already feel top becoming the lane to support. I think we're going to start seeing sustain fighters such as {{champion:5}} {{champion:19}} and {{champion:266}} become popular because of the early rift herald pressure, and of course a support to peel for them while they are taking the camp.

Duo bot isnt going to last much longer, at least not in the same style as it is now. Rift Herald -> T1 Tower is going to become the early game goal.

I could see mid becoming the new duo lane because it allows 2 people to help with/contest either dragon or herald without spending summoner spells to do so.  Although that would mean you'd need 2 people who can be safe and self-sufficient in long lanes, and not leave much of a place for level-dependent squishy immobile mages.
